meanings.definition: Enjoy oneself in a lively and noisy way, especially with drinking and dancing.
meanings.sent1: The children will revel in the playground, laughing and playing together.
meanings.sent2: She always revels in the joy of dancing at parties.
meanings.sent3: The puppies revel in chasing each other around the yard.
meanings.sent4: The flowers revel in the sunlight, blooming brightly in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The students revel in the excitement of the school talent show.

meanings.definition: Take great pleasure or delight in something.
meanings.sent1: I revel in the beauty of nature every time I go for a walk.
meanings.sent2: He revels in the taste of his favorite ice cream flavor.
meanings.sent3: The cat revels in the warmth of the sunbeam on the windowsill.
meanings.sent4: She revels in the melody of her favorite song, humming along happily.
meanings.sent5: The audience revels in the magic of the circus performance, clapping and cheering.

meanings.definition: To engage in lively and noisy festivities.
meanings.sent1: The town will revel in the annual carnival, with music and laughter filling the streets.
meanings.sent2: They revel in the holiday spirit, decorating their homes with lights and ornaments.
meanings.sent3: The family will revel in the reunion party, sharing stories and memories.
meanings.sent4: The crowd will revel in the excitement of the parade, waving flags and cheering.
meanings.sent5: The friends revel in the birthday celebration, singing and dancing together.
